info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 11:21AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Whiteside, northeastern Henry and northwestern Bureau Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1120 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tampico, or 8 miles southwest of Rock Falls, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Emerson around 1125 AM CDT. Rock Falls and Deer Grove around 1130 AM CDT. Sterling around 1140 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 23 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
